table_description: GitHub Issues are used to track ideas, enhancements, tasks, or bugs for work on GitHub.

columns.name: number
columns.description: The issue number.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The ID of the issue.

columns.name: node_id
columns.description: The node ID of the issue.

columns.name: active_lock_reason
columns.description: Reason that the conversation was locked.

columns.name: author
columns.description: The actor who authored the issue.

columns.name: author_login
columns.description: The login of the issue author.

columns.name: author_association
columns.description: Author's association with the subject of the issue.

columns.name: body
columns.description: Identifies the body of the issue.

columns.name: body_url
columns.description: URL for this issue body.

columns.name: closed
columns.description: If true, issue is closed.

columns.name: closed_at
columns.description: Timestamp when issue was closed.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Timestamp when issue was created.

columns.name: created_via_email
columns.description: If true, issue was created via email.

columns.name: editor
columns.description: The actor who edited the issue.

columns.name: full_database_id
columns.description: Identifies the primary key from the database as a BigInt.

columns.name: includes_created_edit
columns.description: If true, issue was edited and includes an edit with the creation data.

columns.name: is_pinned
columns.description: if true, this issue is currently pinned to the repository issues list.

columns.name: is_read_by_user
columns.description: if true, this issue has been read by the user.

columns.name: last_edited_at
columns.description: Timestamp when issue was last edited.

columns.name: locked
columns.description: If true, issue is locked.

columns.name: milestone
columns.description: The milestone associated with the issue.

columns.name: published_at
columns.description: Timestamp when issue was published.

columns.name: state
columns.description: The state of the issue.

columns.name: state_reason
columns.description: The reason for the issue state.

columns.name: title
columns.description: The title of the issue.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: Timestamp when issue was last updated.

columns.name: url
columns.description: URL for the issue.

columns.name: assignees_total_count
columns.description: Count of assignees on the issue.

columns.name: comments_total_count
columns.description: Count of comments on the issue.

columns.name: labels_total_count
columns.description: Count of labels on the issue.

columns.name: labels_src
columns.description: The first 100 labels associated to the issue.

columns.name: labels
columns.description: A map of labels for the issue.

columns.name: user_can_close
columns.description: If true, user can close the issue.

columns.name: user_can_react
columns.description: If true, user can react on the issue.

columns.name: user_can_reopen
columns.description: If true, user can reopen the issue.

columns.name: user_can_subscribe
columns.description: If true, user can subscribe to the issue.

columns.name: user_can_update
columns.description: If true, user can update the issue,

columns.name: user_cannot_update_reasons
columns.description: A list of reason why user cannot update the issue.

columns.name: user_did_author
columns.description: If true, user authored the issue.

columns.name: user_subscription
columns.description: Subscription state of the user to the issue.

columns.name: assignees
columns.description: A list of Users assigned to the issue.
